fields.name: searchTransactionsForward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: dfuse Search Query Language string

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusively. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Higher block num boundary, inclusively. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`). A `null` value means no higher limits, therefore searching into the future of the chain.

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your search if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call. It is safe to use the same cursor in BOTH directions (forward and backward).

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results streamed back.

arguments.name: irreversibleOnly
arguments.description: When true, only stream back results once they pass the irreversibility boundary. Otherwise, allow fetching results up to the head block.

arguments.name: liveMarkerInterval
arguments.description:
If non-zero, indicates you want to mark the stream when reaching live blocks. A marker is a response with a `trace` equal to `null`, which will be sent at each `liveMarkerInterval` blocks. The first `trace` to be equal to `null` in a stream indicates you are now processing live blocks.

The value for `liveMarkerInterval` is a number of blocks.

fields.name: searchTransactionsBackward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain backward for transaction execution traces based on `query`.

NOTE: The `undo` field is not used in backwards search.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: dfuse Search Query Language string

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusively. The absence of a value, or a value of 0 means the beginning of the chain. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Higher block num boundary, inclusively. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`), -1 being the head block.

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your search if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call. It is safe to use the same cursor in BOTH directions (forward and backward).

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results streamed back.

arguments.name: irreversibleOnly
arguments.description: When true, only stream back results that have passed the irreversibility boundary. Otherwise, allow fetching results up to the head block.

fields.name: getAccountHistoryActions
fields.description:
WARNING: This is a BETA Query. IT MIGHT STILL CHANGE.

Retrieve the last actions, that are irreversible, and that:
1) notified an account, or
2) was authorized by an account.

Results are _actions_, returned in reverse order (from recent to older actions).

NOTE: usually, the backing service of this method holds a _truncated_ window of history, per account.

Read the `cursor` in the response, and pass it back to `cursor` to continue paginating. This is a short-lived cursor, especially as the truncation window goes by.

arguments.name: account
arguments.description: Account name to query for actions

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of actions returned in this page.  Max limit allowed for this call is 1000

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Optional cursor to continue where you left off, taken from results of a previous call to this `getActions` query.

fields.name: searchTransactionsForward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

When the returned `cursor` is empty, it means you have reached the end of the specified block range.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.

See also the streaming version under `Subscription`

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: dfuse Search Query Language string

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusively. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Higher block num boundary, inclusively. A zero or negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your search if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call. It is safe to use the same cursor in BOTH directions (forward and backward).

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results per page of results (defaults to 100).

arguments.name: irreversibleOnly
arguments.description: When true, only stream back results once they pass the irreversibility boundary. Otherwise, allow fetching results up to the head block.

fields.name: searchTransactionsBackward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain backward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

When the returned `cursor` is empty, it means you have reached the end of the specified block
range.

See also the streaming version under `Subscription`

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: dfuse Search Query Language string

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusively. A value of 0 means the beginning of the chain. A negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Higher block num boundary, inclusively. A zero or negative value means a block relative to the head or last irreversible block (depending on `irreversibleOnly`).

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your search if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call. It is safe to use the same cursor in BOTH directions (forward and backward).

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results per page of results (defaults to 100).

arguments.name: irreversibleOnly
arguments.description: When true, only stream back results once they pass the irreversibility boundary. Otherwise, allow fetching results up to the head block.

fields.name: blockIDByTime
fields.description: Return the block ID found around the given `time`, based on the `comparator` provided.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: Timestamp for comparison, in format 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z or 2006-01-02T15:04:05.123Z

fields.name: blockIDAtAccountCreation
fields.description: Return the block Number where given `account` was created.

fields.name: block
fields.description: ALPHA Get a single block by its ID or its number. You cannot specify both.

fields.name: tokens
fields.description: ALPHA Get a list of contract tokens

arguments.name: tokenSymbols
arguments.description: List of token symbols (EOS) to filter the results against

arguments.name: tokenContracts
arguments.description: List of token contracts (eosio.token) to filter the results against

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Cursor used for pagination

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of results to include in a result

arguments.name: sortField
arguments.description: Token attribute used to sort the results

arguments.name: sortOrder
arguments.description: Direction in which to sort the results

fields.name: accountBalances
fields.description: ALPHA Get a list of token balances for a specific account

arguments.name: account
arguments.description: The account whose balances you are retrieveing

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Cursor used for pagination

arguments.name: tokenSymbols
arguments.description: List of token symbols (EOS) to filter the results against

arguments.name: tokenContracts
arguments.description: List of token contracts (eosio.token) to filter the results against

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of results to include in a result

arguments.name: sortField
arguments.description: Token attribute used to sort the results

arguments.name: sortOrder
arguments.description: Direction in which to sort the results

fields.name: tokenBalances
fields.description: ALPHA Get a list of token balances for a specific contract & symbol

arguments.name: contract
arguments.description: The token's contract you are retrieving

arguments.name: symbol
arguments.description: The token's symbol you are retrieving

arguments.name: tokenHolders
arguments.description: List of token holders to filter the results against

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Cursor used for pagination

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of results to include in a result

arguments.name: sortField
arguments.description: Token attribute used to sort the results

arguments.name: sortOrder
arguments.description: Direction in which to sort the results

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of this block. It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: num
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain. Unlike the hash, it is not unique because of forked blocks.

fields.name: dposLIBNum
fields.description: The Last Irreversible Block number this chain is based at the DPoS consensus layer.

fields.name: irreversible
fields.description: Indicates whether this block is irreversible.

fields.name: header
fields.description: Header . It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: executedTransactionCount
fields.description: Number of transaction found in this blocks, this is the number of 'executed' transaction count.

fields.name: transactionTraces
fields.description: List of transactions contained in this block.

name: BlockHeader
description: BlockHeader is the header of a block, excluding the transactions in that block.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this block in the chain.

fields.name: num
fields.description: The block number in the chain.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp of this block, this is the actual time at which the block was procuded.

fields.name: producer
fields.description: The block producer who producer this block.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: How may confirmations of verification this block has received from other block producers.

fields.name: previous
fields.description: The previous block ID in the block chain this block is based on.

fields.name: transactionMRoot
fields.description: The transaction receipt Merkle root node hash of this block, this is the 'transaction_mroot' in EOSIO.

fields.name: actionMRoot
fields.description: The action receipt Merkle root node hash of this block, this is the 'action_mroot' in EOSIO.

fields.name: scheduleVersion
fields.description: The producer schedule version this block is based on. The schedule is the list of active producer and their assigned block production slot.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges to transaction traces

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid pagination

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Trasaction trace cursor

fields.name: node
fields.description: Trasaction trace

name: PageInfo
description: Cursors required to continue either forward or backwards from a list of paginated elements

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: cursor of the first element of the list, use it to search in the opposite direction

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: cursor of the last element of the list, use it to continue

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: indicates whether there is a next page

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: indicates whether there is a previous page

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: This is a chain-wide cursor, indicating the progress of a search. You can pass it back to the different search methods to continue fetching more results, in *either directions* (even in the reverse direction). A `null` cursor means the end of range has been reached.

name: SearchTransactionForwardResponse
description:
A single transaction trace response, matching a forward search query.

WARNING: do NOT forget to include the `undo` field to determine if the message is actually a REVERSAL of the transaction.

NOTE: always check the value of `trace.status` to make sure it is `executed` if you want to make sure a transaction made it to the chain.

fields.name: undo
fields.description:
Whether this response is an UNDO operation of a previously sent response.

In a forward search, make sure you catch this and always verify its value.. as to not double or triple count transactions.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Chain-wide cursor, allowing you to continue querying when connection is interrupted

fields.name: isIrreversible
fields.description: Whether the block represented here is irreversible

fields.name: irreversibleBlockNum
fields.description: The last known irreversible block when processing this transaction.  This number can be equal to the current block num (under `trace.block.num`), in which case, `isIrreversible` is true.  In the reversible segment of the chain, this number will be drifting away by the number of blocks separating head block and LIB.

fields.name: trace
fields.description:
Traces of execution of the transaction containing matching actions.

Check `matchingActions` below to limit the response to only actions matching your search query. Although, all actions from the transactions are available (see `executedActions`).

name: SearchTransactionBackwardResponse
description:
A single transaction trace response, matching a backward search query.

NOTE: always check the value of `trace.status` to make sure it is `executed` if you want to make sure a transaction made it to the chain.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Chain-wide cursor, allowing you to continue querying when connection is interrupted

fields.name: isIrreversible
fields.description: Whether the block represented here is irreversible

fields.name: irreversibleBlockNum
fields.description: The last known irreversible block when processing this transaction.  This number can be equal to the current block num (under `trace.block.num`), in which case, `isIrreversible` is true.  In the reversible segment of the chain, this number will be drifting away by the number of blocks separating head block and LIB.

fields.name: trace
fields.description:
Traces of execution of the transaction containing matching actions.

Check `matchingActions` below to limit the response to only actions matching your search query. Although, all actions from the transactions are available (see `executedActions`).

name: SimpleActionTrace
description:
SimpleActionTrace holds the traces of execution of a single action within a transaction, but contains less contextual information from the transaction than an ActionTrace.

This object is used with the `getActions` Query.

fields.name: blockNum
fields.description: Block number in which this action was processed

fields.name: blockID
fields.description: Block ID in which this action was processed.

fields.name: blockTime
fields.description: Time at which the block was produced, according to the block producer

fields.name: trxID
fields.description: Transaction ID originally holding this action

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Global sequence ID for this action in this chain (shorthand for receipt.global_sequence).

fields.name: executionIndex
fields.description: Zero-based index of this action within the transaction, in _execution_ order.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description:
Action receipt (which differs from the Transaction receipt).

The receipt will be null when failures occur. Verify the `status`
field on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description:
Account which code was executed to produce this execution trace.

Shorthand for receipt.receiver

fields.name: account
fields.description:
Target method's account name.  This does *not* correspond to the contract code being executed, that is what `receiver` means.  This value namespaces your actions.

Shorthand for act.account in `nodeos` traces

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Target method's action name. This value, combined with the `account`, determines which code path will be executed in the `receiver` contract code.

Shorthand for act.name in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: authorization
fields.description:
Signatories required to execute this action.

Shorthand for `act.authorization` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
Data payload. Might be a string or a JSON object, depending on whether it was possible to unpack it using an ABI.

Shorthand for `act.data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: json
fields.description:
JSON Object representing the action parameters, decoded through the ABI. Will be `null` if it wasn't possible to decode it.

Shorthand for action.json

fields.name: hexData
fields.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the raw data for the action.

Shorthand for `act.hex_data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: console
fields.description: Output of the action's `print()` statements from within the smart contract.

fields.name: contextFree
fields.description: Whether this action is a context-free action.

fields.name: isNotify
fields.description: Whether this action is a notification, meaning that it was triggered as a side effect rom another contract, and copied the exact same payload from the original transaction.  This happens when you call the `require_notify` method from the EOSIO intrinsics (from within a smart-contract).

name: TransactionTrace
description:
Traces of the execution of a given transaction. This means the
transaction was executed on the chain. You also get context about the
block in which it was executed, and the status of the execution.

WARN: Make sure to always check the `status` (in the `receipt`) to
make sure you're not considering a failed transaction as if it was
successful.

fields.name: block
fields.description: Block in which this transaction trace occurred

fields.name: status
fields.description: This is a short-hand for `receipt.status`.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description: Transaction execution receipt which is the consensus value propagated across the network.

fields.name: elapsed
fields.description:
Amount of execution time in microseconds (Âµs) elapsed by this whole transaction. This
corresponds to the `transaction_trace.elapsed` field in the EOSIO software.

WARN: This is **not** the propagated consensus value. This value is from the EOSIO node
that replayed the transaction from the network. Use `receipt.cpuUsageMicroSeconds` in your
GraphQL operation instead to retrieve the consensus value.

fields.name: netUsage
fields.description:
Amount of network bandwidth consumed (for the sake of the rate limiting engine) by this whole transaction, in
bytes. This corresponds to the `transaction_trace.net_usage` field in the EOSIO software (which is usually
equivalent to `receipt.net_usage_words * 8`).

WARN: This is **not** the propagated consensus value. This value is from the EOSIO node
that replayed the transaction from the network. While there is no reason to not match the
consensus value, it still could be different.  Use `receipt.netUsageWords` in your
GraphQL operation instead to retrieve the consensus value (multiple it by 8 to get the amount of
bytes).

fields.name: scheduled
fields.description: Whether this transaction was originally a scheduled transaction.

fields.name: executedActions
fields.description: Lists all action traces, flattened and ordered by execution time.

fields.name: matchingActions
fields.description: Returns a flattened list of action traces, in _execution_ order, of only the matching transactions (from a search, or other filtering).

fields.name: topLevelActions
fields.description: Traces of actions at depth=0, those part of the original Transaction. In `nodeos` version 1.7.0 and below, this corresponds to the `action_traces` field.

name: ActionTrace
description: ActionTrace holds the traces of execution of a single action within a transaction.

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Global sequence ID for this action in this chain (shorthand for receipt.global_sequence). NOTE: if this is a failed action, seq will be 0.

fields.name: executionIndex
fields.description: Zero-based index of this action within the transaction, in _execution_ order.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description:
Action receipt (which differs from the Transaction receipt).

The receipt will be null when failures occur. Verify the `status`
field on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description:
Account which code was executed to produce this execution trace.

Shorthand for receipt.receiver

fields.name: account
fields.description:
Target method's account name.  This does *not* correspond to the contract code being executed, that is what `receiver` means.  This value namespaces your actions.

Shorthand for act.account in `nodeos` traces

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Target method's action name. This value, combined with the `account`, determines which code path will be executed in the `receiver` contract code.

Shorthand for act.name in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: authorization
fields.description:
Signatories required to execute this action.

Shorthand for `act.authorization` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
Data payload. Might be a string or a JSON object, depending on whether it was possible to unpack it using an ABI.

Shorthand for `act.data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: json
fields.description:
JSON Object representing the action parameters, decoded through the ABI. Will be `null` if it wasn't possible to decode it.

Shorthand for action.json

fields.name: hexData
fields.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the raw data for the action.

Shorthand for `act.hex_data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: ramOps
fields.description:
A list of RAM mutation operations, produced by this transaction.

NOTE: the RAM ops on an action never include operations that are mutations of the transaction itself (like creation of a deferred, or removal of a deferred from RAM). For this, check `ramOps` on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: dtrxOps
fields.description: A list of all operations affecting deferred transactions, like creation, deletion, modification, produced by this action.

fields.name: tableOps
fields.description: A list of table mutation operations (creation or deletion of a _table_, not a _row_).

fields.name: dbOps
fields.description: A list of database operations produced by this action. Insertions, modifications and deletions of any table _rows_ in the scope of this action's `receiver`.

fields.name: console
fields.description: Output of the action's `print()` statements from within the smart contract.

fields.name: contextFree
fields.description: Whether this action is a context-free action.

fields.name: elapsed
fields.description: Elapsed time between the beginning of the execution of this action, relative to the time the whole transaction started to be processed

fields.name: exceptJSON
fields.description: If non-null, this action failed. The stack and reasons will be found within the raw JSON payload provided.

fields.name: isNotify
fields.description: Whether this action is a notification, meaning that it was triggered as a side effect rom another contract, and copied the exact same payload from the original transaction.  This happens when you call the `require_notify` method from the EOSIO intrinsics (from within a smart-contract).

fields.name: isMatchingQuery
fields.description: Whether or not this action matched the dfuse search query

fields.name: createdActions
fields.description: Traces of actions _created_ by this action. WARN: this doesn't infer that the operations were written to the blockchain in this order, only that it was created by this action. To obtain execution order, see `executedActions` on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: creatorAction
fields.description: Trace of the action that created this one, the one which _created_ this action. WARN: it is not necessarily the parent in execution order, but will reflect which smart contract did the creation of either the notification, action or context_free_action.

fields.name: closestUnnotifiedAncestorAction
fields.description:
Use this to rebuild the execution tree, using the `nodeos` dispatch algorithm of notifications, actions and context-free actions.

This is similar to what you would have gotten in `nodeos` prior to version 1.8.0.

name: RAMOp
description: Represents a change in consumption of RAM for a given account

fields.name: operation
fields.description: What happened to justify this change in RAM.

fields.name: payer
fields.description: The account being debited or credited RAM

fields.name: delta
fields.description: Number of bytes that were either consumed (positive) or released (negative)

fields.name: usage
fields.description:
Number of bytes now used by the `payer` account, after applying this RAM operation.

To have a precise view of the RAM left on an account after this transaction was applied, go through all actions in execution order (`TransactionTrace.executedActions`) and use the last RAMOp for the given account.

name: DTrxOp
description: A change in deferred transactions in the chain's memory.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: The source or cause of creation/modification/deletion of a deferred transaction

fields.name: payer
fields.description: The account being debited or credited to store this deferred transaction

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description: The time this deferred was published at

fields.name: delayUntil
fields.description: The time at which Block Producers will start attempting to execute this transaction

fields.name: expirationAt
fields.description: The time at which Block Producers will evict this transaction from memory if it fails execution.

fields.name: trxID
fields.description: The transaction ID of the `transaction`

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: The deferred transaction payload itself.

name: TableOp
description: Creation or deletion of a table

name: DBOp
description: Represents the mutation of a row, in a contract table.

fields.name: oldPayer
fields.description: Previous paying account.  This is null in the case of an insertion.

fields.name: newPayer
fields.description: New paying account.  This is null in the case of a deletion.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Primary key of the row in the table.

fields.name: oldData
fields.description: Contents (hex data) of the row before a REM or UPD operation.

fields.name: newData
fields.description: Contents (hex data) of the row after an INS or UPD operation.

fields.name: oldJSON
fields.description: Decoded version of oldData

fields.name: newJSON
fields.description: Decoded version of newData

name: ActionReceipt
description:
Execution receipt for a given ActionTrace.

The `nodeos` field `auth_sequence` is not yet present. Contact us if you need it.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: Account for which code is being triggered. Beware that this might not be the same value as `account`, or the target account of the action, in the case of notifications. See documentation for `require_notify` in EOSIO contracts

fields.name: digest
fields.description: Hash of the action payload. Also known as `act_digest` from `nodeos`

fields.name: globalSequence
fields.description:
Globally unique sequence number in all actions from the longest chain. This will never be reused, and is guaranteed to monotonically increment with each action.

This property can be relied on to keep track of forks in your database, at the action level.

WARNING: when micro-forks happens, global sequences from the different forks will be reused, but will be associated with other actions. This is why it's important to navigate forks properly.

fields.name: refBlockNum
fields.description:
TaPoS reference block num.

This value holds only 16 bits of the blockNum (instead of 32).
The other 16 bits are in the current blockNum (unless overflown).

fields.name: refBlockPrefix
fields.description: TaPoS block prefix (bytes 8-16 of the block ID), in order to identify the correct fork for a given block number.

fields.name: time
fields.description: "true" if a block id was found

name: TokenConnection
description: The Connection type for a Token

fields.name: blockRef
fields.description: `block` is the block at which the token data is valid

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges to tokens

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid pagination

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: See https://docs.dfuse.io/eosio/public-apis/reference/search/cursors

fields.name: node
fields.description: The Token object.

fields.name: number
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain.

fields.name: contract
fields.description: Contract that created the token i.e.: eosio.token

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: Symbol of token  i.e.: EOS

fields.name: precision
fields.description: Token precision

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: Token contract issuer: eosio

fields.name: holders
fields.description: Number of token holders

fields.name: maximumSupply
fields.description: Token's maximum supply

fields.name: totalSupply
fields.description: Token's total supply

name: AccountBalanceConnection
description: The Connection type for a Account Balance

fields.name: blockRef
fields.description: `block` is the block at which the token data is valid

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges to account balances

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid pagination

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: See https://docs.dfuse.io/eosio/public-apis/reference/search/cursors

fields.name: node
fields.description: The account balance object.

fields.name: contract
fields.description: Contract that created the token i.e.: eosio.token

fields.name: account
fields.description: Account holding the token

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: Symbol of token  i.e.: EOS

fields.name: precision
fields.description: Token precision

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Amount of the token held in the account

name: PageInfo
description: Cursors required to continue either forward or backwards from a list of paginated elements

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: cursor of the first element of the list, use it to search in the opposite direction

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: cursor of the last element of the list, use it to continue

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: indicates whether there is a next page

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: indicates whether there is a previous page
